description: Distribute balls with overlaps until a target porosity is achieved. Ball positions and radii are drawn from uniform distributions (or Gaussian/FISH distributions). Significant ball overlaps will likely result from this operation. This command contrasts with ball generate where balls are generated without overlap.

keywords.name: porosity
keywords.description: Target porosity value (not accounting for overlap)

keywords.name: box
keywords.description: Balls fully contained within box (won't overlap box faces/edges)

keywords.name: bin
keywords.description: Specify distribution properties for bin i

keywords.name: resolution
keywords.description: Multiplicative factor for all generated ball radii

bin_keywords.name: gauss
bin_keywords.description: Use Gaussian distribution with mean=(radlow+radhi)/2, std=(radhi-radlow)/2. Optional f (default 0.1) sets minimum radius

bin_keywords.name: fish-distribution
bin_keywords.description: Use FISH function to generate radii. Cannot be used with gauss or radius

bin_keywords.name: volume-fraction
bin_keywords.description: Volume fraction for this bin (all bins must sum to 1.0)

examples.description: Distribute balls with radius 1.0-1.6 to achieve 30% porosity (allows overlaps)

examples.command: ball distribute number-bins 2 bin 1 radius 0.5 1.0 volume-fraction 0.6 bin 2 radius 1.0 1.5 volume-fraction 0.4 porosity 0.35
examples.description: Two size distributions: 60% small balls (0.5-1.0), 40% large balls (1.0-1.5)

examples.command: ball distribute radius 1.0 1.5 gauss 0.1 porosity 0.32 box -10 10 -10 10 -5 5
examples.description: Gaussian distribution in specified box region

examples.command: ball distribute number-bins 1 bin 1 radius 0.8 1.2 group 'layer1' volume-fraction 1.0 porosity 0.38

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('ball distribute ...') - no Python SDK equivalent for porosity-based distribution with overlaps
